storyInfo: The Doctor and Amiya see Priestess in the information stored within the Black Crown. From a fragment of Oracle's experimental records, they obtain the knowledge they seek.

attributes.content: The scene plays out before you, but no matter how hard you try, you cannot get any closer.
Doctor, that person she's talking to... Is that you?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: ......;I can't say for sure.

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I don't believe I'll be able to create a language that will allow us to derive the ultimate answer. Not by myself, at least.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I stand on the shoulders of giants, after all. From the base I put together with the greatest discoveries of our colleagues' respective fields, I will continue onwards.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Even if nothing will come of it in the end?
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Of course. It wouldn't be the first time.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Does it look like we have anything better to do while we quietly wait for the darkness to swallow us?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Besides, I'm sure you won't say no to me, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) So, where are you starting your research from?
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Priestess does not answer, electing to instead look at the faint dawn light peeking over the horizon. The one next to her does not bother her any further.
The two of them simply stand aboard the deck.
You look at her, and subconsciously tell yourself: 'She's pondering something again'—
Why did you think that all of a sudden?
What is it, Doctor?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Nothing, just zoned out.
I don't think we'll be finding any important clues here.

attributes.content: The information Dr. Kal'tsit wants isn't here?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: This is most likely a fragment of history from before Originium was born.
Based on what I experienced in the Assimilated Universe, at least.

attributes.content: Doctor, you mean what we're seeing right now is because you...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: That's not all, I'm afraid.

attributes.content: —Then that huge ship floating in the sky and that giant, shattered sphere are also...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I'm not too sure what relation I have with them.

attributes.content: We'll make it clear, then.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But since you're sure this isn't our main target, we should continue onwards.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The singularity is right in front of us, but the bridge I built is reaching its limit.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The information density here's too high. Pressing onwards is like drowning in a deep river.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: ...How are we going to find the information we need in all this chaos?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Allow me.

attributes.content: Your thoughts come infinitely close to the singularity, all while the near-physical deluge of information presses down on the two of you...
While you yourself seem able to adapt to the pressure, you sense a great strain on Amiya.
You don't have much time.
You pull out every keyword the 'Priestess' in the Assimilated Universe said, and quickly connect together every clue left behind by Kal'tsit.
Calculate a new result as quickly as you can, then add a new condition... Continue this cycle until you have isolated the information you need.
Your thoughts are like diving into an endless ocean of building blocks. What you need to do is not particularly complicated.
Find the blocks that are different, their surfaces finely engraved with the words Kal'tsit left for you—

attributes.options: I think we did it, Amiya.

attributes.content: Where... Where are we?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Rhodes Island.;The Rhodes Island of the past.

attributes.content: But this place and our Rhodes Island are—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Completely different.

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit once said the ship was excavated in Rim Billiton and had to be repaired before it could be used.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Just... Just what exactly has Rhodes Island gone through?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I haven't the slightest idea.

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Looks like you're in good spirits today. I guess our efforts paid off.
(Unknown language) Were you scared, waiting by yourself in the lab?
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Proud purring)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Good timing then. I'm currently trying to put together a model that reduces the loss of meta-information during transmission through special mediums. Can you try helping me do some calculations?
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Restless twitching)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Alright, that's enough. I terminated your process.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You are to never harm your own core unit, even if an order comes from me or her.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Protect yourself, AMa-10. Survival is an instinct the living are born with.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Stubborn purring)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Haha, at least your emotional module is iterating quickly.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: Do you understand their language, Doctor?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I don't.
Ignore that person and the thing by their side.;What we need is somewhere else.

attributes.content: You're right. Since Dr. Kal'tsit believed we would be able to find the key, she must have anticipated the language barrier.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Look at the glass next to that person, Doctor. It's got writing written all over it.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Formulas?

attributes.content: (Unknown language) It's a shame the development of Originium isn't going very smoothly.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) We're venturing into uncharted territory here. It's hard for others to keep up with us.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) While I have been engrossed in debate with her more often than not lately, our experimental progress has slowed.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Vigorous consolation)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) No need to worry about us. If this model's operational efficiency meets expectations, we might be able to cross the first hurdle on Originium's development.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Oh, right, Lu's sent us a message. There's been a rare breakthrough in the Caerula Arbor, and she'll be able to come visit us again soon.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Heartfelt joy)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Looks like you're very fond of her.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.options: Amiya, we need to note down those formulas!

attributes.content: I'm trying—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: What's happening?;Is the bridge's stability under attack?

attributes.content: Theresa warned me about this. It's Civilight Eterna's baseline logic trying to eliminate loopholes!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Because we're trying to transcribe information from outside the boundary.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Doctor, I don't understand what the characters in these formulas mean—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Forget about understanding them!;We just need to record them down!;I'm memorizing them as best I can too!

attributes.content: The information of the boundary begins to reorganize. The loophole is being repaired, and the scene you are witnessing begins to rapidly fade away.
(Unknown language) I've foreseen it, AMa-10. This model she and I developed together will succeed.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I look forward to the day that language's creation is truly complete—
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Kindly reminder)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) DWDB-221E's synchronization is still underway? *sigh* I know that. It's not like I forgot myself, right?
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: The speaker starts to fade away as well.
(Whispering in unknown language) No matter where in this vast universe you came from, I bid you to witness the beacons we left behind, remnants of a civilization now gone to eternal rest.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Whispering in unknown language) Perhaps it will be our blessing... and the final gift of hope.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: You begin to feel like that person is... looking right at you?
(Anxious murmuring)
attributes.name: Primitive Construct

attributes.content: (Unknown language) ...We will see it come to be, AMa-10. I believe it so.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: The formulas are beginning to vanish!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Retreat, while we still have the bridge.

attributes.content: But I haven't—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: You still have me!;We can reconstruct them together.

attributes.content: A massive attack strikes your thoughts, and you sense yourself falling.
The last act of consciousness you remember is keeping Amiya as far as possible from the singularity, and that familiar figure—
Thank you for bringing Amiya back here. Now...
attributes.name: Civilight Eterna

attributes.content: Leave.
attributes.name: Civilight Eterna

attributes.content: It is at this moment that the mental link between you and Amiya breaks. Your mind is so exhausted you do not remember anything that happened afterwards.
The two of you leave Civilight Eterna.
The information erupting from the singularity does not cease, and among the flow, there is an insignificant scene that has never been accessed since the day of its recording—
In the quiet of space, a ray of light illuminates a field of stars, bringing with it darkness and a despair beyond doubt.

When sensors tens of thousands of light-years away receive the image of this starfield from the distant past, the planets that these stars shed their light upon are already filled with graveyards and ruins.
It has come.
Did the Presence tell you to use these words to defend her?
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: No, she never asked me to do such a thing when she left.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Then keep your wits around her. Don't let her confuse you.
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: ...Because if you let down your guard thanks to her charm, she might put you in danger. That's how her people hunt. It's their instinct.
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: As for the person you're looking for, Priestess, the master of the ship...
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: She's doing some important research right now. I'm afraid her consciousness is shuttling back and forth between various research locations in this starfield.
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: It'll be very hard for you to have a moment with her if she's not willing.
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: Hierda, are you so desperate to find her because you want to thank the person who rescued you?
attributes.name: Raydistorter

attributes.content: Not exactly.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I understand that I'm in some fantastical place called the 'universe', and it's not the afterlife, either...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I even have a wild guess that my home of Terra might be somewhere out there in this universe.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: But the more I know, the more questions I have. I want to ask her—
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Why am I not dead?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Where exactly is my home, Terra?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The Cautus looks out through the porthole at the stars in frustration.
Perhaps it is because her bishop and the rest of her fellow churchgoers are still praying for her back in her land, but she has no way to respond.
She curls up against the wall, allowing the light of the stars to quickly sweep across her face.
It turns out you can see time passing by with your own eyes.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: She has met many people aboard this ship. No matter if they were the respected, hooded genius tucked away in the lab, or the wanderer of the universe who had survived ruination...
Their optimism and kindness have dispelled her initial fear, but she knows that she will never truly be one of the crew of this miraculous ship.
'I miss Terra already.'
